briefTitle: Safety and Tolerability of a Single Dose of FCM vs. Standard of Care in Treating Iron Deficiency Anemia
officialTitle: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Controlled Study to Investigate the Safety and Tolerability of a Single Dose of Intravenous Ferric Carboxymaltose (FCM) vs. Standard Medical Care in Treating Iron Deficiency Anemia in Subjects Who Are Not Dialysis Dependent

interventions.name: Standard Medical Care (SMC)
otherNames: Ferrous Sulfate, Venofer, Ferrlecit, Infed, Dexferrum

summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety of FCM in patients with anemia who are not dialysis dependent

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (SAE's)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: through 30 days after the last dose of study drug (FCM or SMC for the treatment of IDA)
